props.alt: Alternate text for screen readers. Leave empty for decorative images.
props.aspectRatio: Calculated as width/height, so for a 1920x1080px image this will be 1.7778. Will be calculated automatically if omitted.
props.contain: Prevents the image from being cropped if it doesn’t fit.
props.eager: Will force the components content to render on mounted.
props.gradient: Overlays a gradient onto the image. Only supports [linear-gradient](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/linear-gradient) syntax, anything else should be done with classes.
props.height: Sets the height for the component.
props.lazySrc: Something to show while waiting for the main image to load, typically a small base64-encoded thumbnail. Has a slight blur filter applied.
props.maxHeight: Sets the maximum height for the component.
props.maxWidth: Sets the maximum width for the component.
props.minHeight: Sets the minimum height for the component.
props.minWidth: Sets the minimum width for the component.
props.options: Options that are passed to the [Intersection observer](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Intersection_Observer_API) constructor.
props.position: Overrides the default to change which parts get cropped off. Uses the same syntax as [`background-position`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/background-position).
props.src: The image URL. This prop is mandatory.
props.srcset: A set of alternate images to use based on device size. [Read more…](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/img#attr-srcset)
props.transition: The transition to use when switching from lazy-src to src.
props.width: Sets the width for the component.

emits.error: Emitted when there is an error.
